summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the HSCA's staff payroll records. It details the Board's final decision to release previously withheld information, justified by its historical significance and the determination that disclosure would not compromise national security or individual privacy. Notably, it includes the payroll authorization for Richard Newcombe Billings, appointed as Editorial Chief at a salary of $30,000.00, alongside memoranda on payroll certification processes and his appointment, with specific attention to the redaction of Social Security numbers for privacy protection and the disclosure of any affiliations with current Members of Congress.
key_findings: The Review Board decided to release previously withheld information due to its historical value and the absence of risk to national security or personal privacy.
Social Security numbers were redacted to safeguard individual privacy.
Richard Newcombe Billings was appointed as Editorial Chief with an initial salary of $30,000.00.
The document outlines payroll certification procedures, including the requirement to disclose any connections to current Members of Congress.
